analysis:
Right, let me tell you something about this trade - it's an absolute disaster for finthefiddle, and I don't say that lightly. At the end of the day, this comes down to points, and they've given up a running back in Dylan Sampson who was averaging 16.3 points per game for Calvin Ridley, who's now limping along at 4.1 points. That's criminal. This reminds me of when the Colts traded a first-round pick for Trent Richardson - everyone thought they were getting a game-changer, and instead they got a player who couldn't find the end zone with a map. Finthefiddle was sat at the top of the table with a 92 Power Score, and they've somehow managed to make themselves worse. You simply cannot give away running back production when it's the scarcest commodity in fantasy football. The numbers don't lie - they lost 85 in value and got nothing back.

Here's the storyline: finthefiddle thought they were the big dog, wheeling and dealing from a position of strength, trying to consolidate talent. But bequietamy, sitting down at 13th in the rankings, has absolutely mugged them off. They've turned Calvin Ridley, a declining 31-year-old putting up 4 points a game, into Christian Kirk AND a potential starting running back. That's the kind of robbery that should require a getaway car. The weak team fleeced the strong one, plain and simple. It's like watching a relegation side convince Manchester City to swap Haaland for a League Two striker.

My bold prediction? In two years' time, we'll look back at this trade and it'll be used as the textbook example of why win-now teams panic and make terrible decisions. Ridley will likely be out of the league or a complete afterthought, while whoever survived between Kirk and Sampson will still have fantasy relevance. The -14.1 point drop for Sampson post-trade shows his situation changed, but the potential was there - you don't average 16.3 on a fluke.

The winner here is bequietamy, and it's not even close. They've gained 85 in value while giving up absolutely nothing. Finthefiddle thought they were being clever, but they've shot themselves in the foot. That's the result, that's what matters, and there's no debate to be had.
